chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis B Dodge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must have no contact with whatsoever with the victim or her family unless there is written consent to same. Must have no unsupervised contact with minors.
Must register as a sex offender for life. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

No corrections to the PSI by parties.

State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation. Defendant addresses the court. 

Court relates and orders: 

5 years initial confinement  - Dodge Correctional Institution. 
Defendant are not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant are not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

15 years extended supervision: 
Must register as a sex offender for life. 
Must have no contact whatsoever with the victim or her family unless there is written consent to same. 
Must have no unsupervised contact with minors. 
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Costs.
